# Lade die CSV-Dateien

```{r}

train <- read.csv("resources/test.csv")

test <- read.csv("resources/test.csv")

solution <- read.csv("resources/solution.csv")

```


# Zeige die ersten paar Zeilen der geladenen Daten an

```{r}
print(head(test))
```

```{r}
if (nrow(test) == nrow(solution)) {
  combined <- merge(test, solution)

  print(head(combined))
}
```

```{r}
data <- rbind(train, test)

print(head(combined))

```


```{r}
install.packages("caret")
install.packages("randomForest")

library(caret)

folds <- 5

trainControl <- trainControl(method = "cv", number = folds)

library(randomForest)

# Parameter fÃ¼r den Random Forest
rfParams <- list(ntree = 500, mtry = 3) # Anzahl der BÃ¤ume und Anzahl der Variablen pro Split

# Training mit k-fold Cross-Validation
rfModel <- train(SalePrice ~ ., data = data, method = "rf", trControl = trainControl, tuneGrid = rfParams)

# Zeige eine Zusammenfassung des trainierten Modells
print(rfModel)

# Zeige die Ergebnisse der k-fold Cross-Validation
print(rfModel$results)
```
